intro: Keraudrenia lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved keraudrenia, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Native to tropical regions of Africa, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural and ecological studies.
